subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: Minor strokes in the shape of ハ/八, as in the top of [[劵]], can be referred to 八. These are very frequently simplified to [[丷]]. Contrast [[劵]]/[[券]], and different forms of {{lang|ja|[[鬲]]}}/{{lang|und|sc=Hans|鬲}}.

subSections.title: References
subSections.text:
* {{Han ref|kx=0126.260|dkj=01450|dj=0274.130|hdz=10241.030|uh=516B|ud=20843|bh=A44B|bd=42059}}

[[Category:Han characters from which katakana were derived|ハ]]

subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etyl}}
{{liushu|ic}}: 八 is two bent lines indicating the original meaning of "to divide". This character is later borrowed to mean "eight" because of homonymy, making the original meaning obsolete (now represented by {{zh-l|*別}}).

subSections.title: Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{zh-forms}}
From {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*brat ~ prat|*brat|cut apart, cut open}}. Cognate to {{zh-l|別}}.

subSections.title: Readings
Compounds
Noun
Etymology 2
subSections.text: The ablaut form of {{m|ja|四||four|tr=yo}}, which it doubles.
